strong.span: Local Distiller Donates Sanitizer to Merced Union High School District

p.a: Families First Coronavirus Response Act (FFCRA) notice foR MUHSd Staff

a.span: Merced County Dept. of Public Health

li.a: Departamento de Salud Pública de California

span.a: Coronavirus Infographic from Livingston Community Health

div.p: MUHSD school nurses are working closely with Merced County Department of Public Health (MDPH) who are, in turn, working closely with the California Department of Public Health (CDPH) and monitoring the situation. The group is also establishing protocols for schools in the event that Coronavirus does spread in Merced County. More information will be shared as this plan develops. In addition, situation updates can be found through the Centers for Disease Control. For resources, prevention tips, & information please visit the MUHSD Health Services webpage below.

hr.p: Superintendent Alan Peterson and Assistant Superintendent Dr. Constantine Aguilar join us to talk about MUHSD's efforts to implement distance learning and the challenges the district faces in doing so in the name of equity for all. They also answer your questions regarding senior activities, grades, state and AP testing, the LCAP, student wellness and more.
Executive Assistant to the Supt. Leslie Rohrback are mentioned as resources and can be reached lrohrback@muhsd.org

p.strong: Check out the Distance Learning Resource Webpage link below to access staff and student resources. There are also help links for Google Classroom and Canvas!
Parents & Guardians Please Complete the Following Steps:

li.strong: Please read the Distance Learning Student Policy:

a.title: Student Policy and Use Agreement re Distance Learning

li.a: Merced Union High School District Distance Learning Policy and Use Agreement

20 de Abril al fin de Escuela

ul.li: Monday through Friday. Dates subject to change based on dates of school closure.
Lunes a Viernes. Fechas sujetas a cambios basado en as fechas que la escuela este cerrada.

hr.p: Pick Up Meals at ONE location daily in parking lots near cafeterias
Recoger las comidas en un lugar diario en los estacionamiento cerca de las cafeterias.
Ubicaciones de recoger comida en todos los sitios escolares.
For kids and teens (18 and under)
No enrollment Required, No Cost. The child must be present.
Para todos niños y adolescents menores de 18 Años

p.em: Merced Union High School District is an equal opportunity provider.

p.span: All MUHSD students prepare for college and careers through rigorous, relevant instruction.

a.title: Link: MUHSD instructional programs, college and scholarship information, course catalog, scope and sequence for courses, and more 21st century educational resources

p.span: Career Technical Education is a course of study that provides academic and technical knowledge and skills.

a.title: Link: Career industry information and district career pathway information

div.p: The LCAP is a three-year plan to address state and local priorities in an effort to improve student outcomes.

p.span: MUHSD will involve all stakeholders to ensure the success of all aspects of the district.

a.title: Link: Quick links for frequently used phone numbers and webpages used by parents and/or community members

p.span: MUHSD is committed to recruiting and retaining highly-qualified staff.

a.title: LInk: Human Resources webpage with employment opportunities, salary schedules, benefits information, etc.

div.a: College Board Cancels May SAT in Response to the Coronavirus

div.p: Please visit the College Board website to link to get the latest updates on AP & SAT testing: College Board Press Releases

article.a: Read more about College Board Cancels May SAT in Response to the Coronavirus

div.a: Young Women's Conference (YWC) Notice to Students

div.p: Upon extensive deliberation regarding the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic with our host campus, Livingston Middle School, and Livingston Union School District administration, the Young Women's Conference (YWC) Committee has come to the resolution to suspend the Eleventh Annual Young Women's Conference indefinitely. Albeit, we have determined this to be a fluid situation. In the coming weeks, we will coordinate with public health officials to identify appropriate protocol in addition to providing relevant information as it is made available to us. We are grateful for your understanding and for your patience as we collectively navigate through this unprecedented situation. We rest assure you that the YWC is committed to the safety and well-being of all parties involved in making our conference possible.

article.a: Read more about Young Women's Conference (YWC) Notice to Students

div.p: In light of recent news reports, this notice is to inform you about the district's efforts to deal with the issue locally and to help ease any concerns that may be out there regarding the Coronavirus. To read the full notice, please visit the following link: MUHSD Health Services

article.a: Read more about MUHSD Information on the Coronavirus

header.h2: A Relevant Education for all at MUHSD

img.alt: Two ASB Male Students together and an icon on the left side that represent Student Involvement
img.title: Student Life

p.span: Along with a strong core academic program, students are highly encouraged to participate in the life of their schools. Principals and staff understand that athletics, band, drama, AG, student leadership, campus clubs and community service are foundational to developing students of character, grit, and civic responsibility.

span.a: View MUHSD's School SItes' Event Calendars

p.span: MUHSD's #1 goal is for students to be both college and career ready. Career Technical Education is offered at MUHSD, which provides students with academic and technical knowledge and the skills necessary to prepare them for further education and/or for careers in current and emerging employment sectors.

div.div:
Merced Union High School District
3430 A Street, Atwater, CA 95301
P: 209-325-2000 | F: 209-385-6442

District Instructional Support Ctr (DISC)
3105 G Street, Merced, CA 95344
P: 209-325-2100 | F: 209-325-2117

span.span: The Merced Union High School District Board of Trustees prohibits unlawful discrimination, harassment, intimidation or bullying against any protected group as identified under Education Code 200 and 220 and Government Code 11135, including actual or perceived sex, sexual orientation, immigration status, gender, ethnic group identification, race or ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, nationality, religion, color, mental or physical disability, age, marital or parental status, gender identity, gender expression, or genetic information, or on the basis of a person's association with a person or group with one or more of these actual or perceived characteristics in any district program or activity that receives or benefits from state financial assistance (5 CCR 4610).

p.span: Inquiries on all matters, including complaints, regarding compliance, may be referred to Debra Glass, Director of Equity and Accountability.
3430 A Street, Atwater, CA 95301 | Phone: 209-325-2065 | E-mail: dglass@muhsd.org
